speaker: James

speaker: Elena

speaker: James

speaker: James

text: And the article argues this leads to 'androgyny' â€“ a falling away of gender distinction not just in roles, but in interests, aspirations, even clothing. If boys and girls are essentially the same, then all sex between them becomes 'homo,' or 'same' sexual.

text: Wait, really? That's quite a leap. Just because interests converge doesn't mean gender evaporates. There's a biological reality there, James, that's deeply ingrained. We're not just interchangeable units.

speaker: James
text: A good question, Elena. And one that makes you wonder if our societal focus on individual choice and identity, while important, sometimes obscures the brute realities of demography.
